description:
first time here! 

Wanted to try something new so I was looking around yelp. 

Saw this place and decided to give it a try! The place is super bright and have quite a bit of table for a small place.

The pot is pretty big and flavor is great. I got the medium pot and some fried buns they are delicious.

If you check in on yelp, you get 10% off your whole bill! SCOREEE !! 

Total for 2 person and some left over was about 33$ +tips 

Not bad. 

I would come back again!!
author: Sandy C.

description:
So this is one of those Szechuan sizzling pot places, and as you expect, the food comes with that standard numbing spiciness, so make sure you like that.

We ended up getting the combo pot with cuttlefish and beef tongue. Overall the dish was okay, I've had better elsewhere, but it wasn't terrible either. The flavoring was a little bit boring, despite the spiciness of the whole dish, there wasn't much going on besides spicy, sweet and salty.

You are able to add a variety of other toppings, the noodles and fish/crab balls being good choices to balance everything else in the pot.

We also ended up ordering a side of noodles (which were pretty much boiled noodles and a soy-like topping), but there weren't too bad. We got a pitcher of the plum juice, but that mostly tasted like a sweet sugary drink. Good for relieving spicy food, but not that great tasting on its own.
author: Tyler T.

description:
I was so happy when I found out that this restaurant also existed in San Francisco! If you love szcheuan food, this is the place to go. 

My boyfriend and I got take out large with beef and lamb as the meat- and it was so big that we had left over for a couple days! It was even better as leftover because all the sauces and juices finally set in! You must also add wide vermicelli to complete the dish though! I was disappointed that they didn't have the garlic flavor when I went. I normally get garlic numbing and spicy flavor. But the regular numbing and spicy was just as good! 

Place: the restaurant is a bit hard to fine. It's at a corner and on the left hand side of the one way! The sign was pretty small so you can definitely miss it! 

I would definitely go back!!
author: Shw L.

description:
Came here to get the dry pot.

Got the dry pot with lamb and duck (garlic + medium spicy). Also go the dry pot with beef and cuddlefish (hot and spicy + extra spicy). Got rice cakes in both and vermicelli.

One thing to note, when you come here, it just feels like a rundown place. It's not a date spot for sure, but I didn't care.

If you like spicy but don't want to be like dripping sweat, probably don't get the extra spicy. As you keep eating it, the heat stacks on. I enjoyed both pots and it was nice having a really spicy one, and then a "cooldown" one.

I wouldn't get cuddlefish again and probably not the lamb. The lamb was actually just chopped up lamb pieces and not slices. I was thinking like hotpot lamb slices, but that was not the case. The duck was actually really good. Thought it had good flavor and still was nice and tender. The beef was standard, I'd opt to go for other less "safe" options like tendon or intestine.

The bowl itself doesn't come with toooo many ingredients so be sure to add on more things. Some kind of noodle is a requirement IMO, we added vermicelli and we all loved that addition (really soaks up the sauce, similar to the potato). 

And this place is pretty cheap too. Spent like 17 bucks and was decently full.
author: Victor D.

description: Good heat, and simple concept. I think this place has good value, though it's not the best dry pot casserole I've had. Note that the medium size is likely to feed at least 2 people. I suggest getting beef tongue, skipping the ribs (not as tender as I expected).
author: Ruobin W.

description:
I love their Sunnyvale location and was delighted when they opened up one in the city. I don't understand why it's not more packed all the time, their sizzling pots are delicious.

My usual combo is medium size (good for 4) with hot and spicy (medium spicy level). I have tried almost all of the meat options and I enjoy all of them. For additional things I would recommend lobster balls, lotus roots, enoki mushrooms, wide vermicelli, crab sticks, and luncheon meat. If you have space for desserts and appetizer, make sure to try out their duck necks, pumpkin pancakes, and Steamed and Fried Chinese Bread.

Price-wise this place is very reasonable, especially if you have a big group. I usually spend around $25 here after tax+tip.
author: Angel C.

description:
It is a Chinese style restaurant that has tables are close together, staff that speak Mandarin, and they use wok to cook the food for you. It was a little hard to find the door is not that visible. 

The restaurant is has authentic Sichuan flavor in their dry pots. There are selected main entrees of meats and vegetables. The medium pot has one meat entree and the large pot has two meat entree. You can customized your dry pot and add additional meats and vegetables to make it your own. They have Sichuan dishes that you may order with your dry pot. 

They offer 10% off your check if you check in on yelp. It is an extra incentive to check this place out if you want to enjoy Sichuan food.
author: Angela G.

description:
Huge portions, come with a group to share! 

We got a medium beef pot with mild spiciness and the hot and spicy flavor. The mild spiciness is doable and does have a kick. I definitely want to try the medium spice to get that full mala experience! We added instant noodle and everything in the pot was really flavorful and delicious when eaten with the rice.

I'll definitely be back here to try their other types of pots. Prices are super reasonable and we even had leftovers!
author: Valerie L.

description:
I've been craving dry hot pot since my friend first took me in NYC, so he took me to this SF dry hot pot and wow it was pretty amazing! The restaurant is not located in the best area so I would definitely Uber here. It's a somewhat small restaurant too so you might have to wait for dinner time. It's got a foreign vibe to it, which always means it's quite authentic. 

Between the two of us, we ordered the large hot pot with extra pork belly, mushrooms, and daikon with a bowl of rice. Let's just say that we took about half of it home haha the portions are pretty generous and the flavors were spot on. I loved the spiciness and tingling sensations I got after eating to my fullest. The ingredients were tasty and fresh! Can't wait to come back for more!
author: Ada C.

description:
Good place to get dry pot. It's not the best dry pot but it hits the spot, especially if you order the right ingredients. The flavors are pretty good!

Some of my faves are cauliflower, quail egg, and celtuce. I do wish their potato was cut into thin slices instead of fry-like batons.

Tips:
- get the medium pot, it's pretty much the same size as the large pot
- avoid watery ingredients like cabbage or tofu as that defeats the purpose of dry pot. stick to the hard, firm ingredients 
- wash down the oily spice with a can of cold herbal tea
author: Michelle R.

description:
This place opened up recently near me, and I finally came to try it out this past Sunday night. My boyfriend and his colleagues use to go to Celestial Flame a lot before it closed down, and he was pretty upset because that was his favorite dry hot pot place.

We ordered the medium sized mala beef tongue pot in medium spicy. HOLY SH*T IT WAS SPICY! Have to say though, We both enjoyed it very much! I've been having this crazy craving for spicy food lately, and this was right up my alley. The beef tongue slices were decently thick, and there were tons of it in our pot! Very soft and tender as well. We also added the wide clear noodles and lotus root to our pot. Fantastic decision. Now if only I was this smart on my final exams...

ANYWAYS, I would highly recommend the beef tongue pot! It was more than enough food for two people. I also had their black plum juice. YUM! would definitely order the pitcher next time. It pairs very well with the spice. Service was also very good! Very kind and attentive. I gotta say for being located in DTSF, this place is super clean inside as well. 

Our bill came out to be around $40, which is a mad steal considering we had two additional add on items, two drinks, and leftovers. I would totally come back because it's reasonably priced for bomb foodz.
author: Maggie L.

description:
Such a fun and memorable meal.  A huge vat of cooked-to-order spicy food, with a burner placed underneath so the oily sauce bubbles while you eat.  Perfect for sharing, though gorging by yourself is definitely a possibility too.  Lunchtime seems a lot less crowded than dinnertime.

Spicy & Hot Beef Short Rib w/ Instant Noodle (Very Spicy option): I ordered the spiciest option and was not disappointed.  Reminds me of the spicier dishes at some really good Sichuan restaurants in Chinatown.  Except something magical happens with the bubbling/sizzling; the liquid vaporizes a little so you might be inhaling spices if you don't wait for your food to cool down.  This could be good or bad, depending on how much you like aromatic spices.  Of the default veggies, I really liked the fried potato chunks.  They did an awesome job of absorbing the chili oil.  The celery created a cooling contrast to the spicy sauce.  The sprouts and cauliflower were boring though.  I added some instant noodles for my carbs (instead of paying extra for a side of rice) and that was a delicious choice.  Loved how the chili oil really clung to each noodle.  Only downside was that the noodles were placed on the bottom and some were scorched then stuck to the pot partway through the meal.  I had mixed feelings about the beef short ribs.  They were delicious, but super awkward to eat.  It's look like someone took a Korean short rib and cut each rib into like 6 pieces, sure to cut through every big bone piece to make smaller bone pieces.  Took a lot of concentration so not to chip your tooth on a bone or accidentally swallow a shard!
author: Adam B.

description:
I wasn't surprised that the previous occupant, the pretentiously named Thoughts Style Cuisine Showroom, had shuttered as it was a strange hybrid of Asian and Italian food served in what looked like dog bowls labeled with head-scratching words. I am surprised, however, at its unlikely replacement, a bustling Chinese dry pot restaurant that acknowledges the huge Asian youth populace living in the immediate area. I didn't see the regular Orpheum theater-going crowd or the wandering tourist traffic I usually see around the 'hood. It was packed with gaggles of giggling Asian girls in the booths and tables of bickering Asian couples, so I fit in just fine albeit longer in the tooth than everybody else.

Pots were indeed sizzling at most of the tables. I was seated in the middle of all the activity and tried to figure out what I could order on my own. In the evening, the only sizes they offer are the $22.99 Medium and the $32.99 Large Combo. The $11.99 Small is apparently offered just at lunch from Monday through Thursday.  Oh I see. When I asked the server if they had a vegetarian selection, she shook her head and told me to get the chicken. All by myself. (Don't wanna be) All by myself. So I ordered a Medium Grilled Cooked Snails in Garlic, medium spicy - that's the second hottest level on their heat meter (photo: http://bit.ly/2FY29af) and hoped for the best. It arrived post haste, and my goodness, it was a mass of sizzling food in a hot pot.

The snails were cooked tender and mixed with broccoli, bean sprouts, peppers, mushrooms, cauliflower, and cilantro in a heavy garlic sauce, and frankly the spice was not nearly as amped up as I was expecting. Even with all that food in front of my face, I needed some kind of side dish and went for the $1.99 Black Fungus, which presumptively came stir-fried in the hot pot itself and not as a separate item (photo: http://bit.ly/2FsEPna). The result was that the fungus was not providing the taste of freshness I was looking for to contrast the hot pot ingredients. Meanwhile, the gas-fueled flickering flame was starting to make me nervous. Lesson learned: Next time I'll bring my posse with me, but first, I have to hire a posse. Now where can I rent one?

FOOD - 3 stars...bring an appetite, bring several appetites, and oh yes, be Asian
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...still has the all-white finishes from the Thought Style days but it felt as busy as any Chinatown eatery
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...not that helpful
TOTAL - 3 stars...it sizzles, it's hot, and there's enough for an army
author: Ed U.

description:
Cold weather calls for shabu and hot pot. It's all about that steam getting all over ya face like a good facial. Not that kind of "facial", you pervs! 

There's not really a shortage of shabu and hot pot places in SF but dry hot pot places? Since Celestial Flame closed, I don't know any restaurant in SF that solely serves this fiery Sichuan specialty. 

So, say hello to Sizzling Pot King that took over the short-loved Thai fusion restaurant: Thoughts Style Cuisine) (https://www.yelp.com/biz/thoughts-style-cuisine-showroom-san-francisco!

Sizzling Pot King is a small chain (Sunnyvale, San Diego, Seattle) that serves dry hot pot consisting of meat and veggies with a myriad of chilies and spices that will light your toilet paper on fiyah! Don't worry, there's a non-spicy option. The good thing about dry hot pot is there's no steam so if you have cake face like me, you'll leave with your eyebrows intact and not melted off! 

My coworker and I thought we were beating the lunch rush by arriving at Sizzling King Pot before 11:30 am but we didn't - it was popping! It was packed with Mandarin speaking customers which was a great sign. 

Since Sizzling Pot King is in soft opening mode, there's a limited menu. The only apps available are potstickers and mantou (steamed buns).

For Dry Hot Pot:
*Choose your proteins (tons of choices): Lamb, pork, beef, rabbit, snails, frog, intestines, tripe, gizzards, tongue, or seafood (lobster, crab, crawfish) are just to name a few.

*Choose your 3 size: Small ($11.99), Medium ($22.99), or Large ($32.99). The small is only available Monday - Thursday. For the large, you can choose two meats. 

*Choose your flavor: Hot & Sour, Garlic, Sweet & Sour, or Seafood. 

*Choose your spice level: Non-spicy, mild-spicy, medium-spicy, or very-spicy.

All dry hot pots come with fried potato, cauliflower, celery, and bean sprouts.

You can customize your dry hot pot with extra veggies, carbs (noodles)and other proteins like spam, sausages, and pig's blood for an extra $.99 to $3.99. 

I highly recommend ordering rice ($1.50/bowl) to help balance all the spicy goodness. 

NO MSG is used. 

My coworker and I ordered the Large Dry Hot Pot w/ half beef tongue and half beef short ribs ($32.99):  http://bit.ly/2onZ0Ie. Flavor: garlic. Spice: medium-spicy. We added silk noodles ($1.99) which is yam noodles like Korean japchae.

The meat, noodle, and veggie medley was so good! The beef tongue was sliced thin and tender with a nice bite. Luckily, there was a good amount of beef tongue because the short ribs were all bones (boo!). The noodles and veggies were all cooked well with the proper texture. I loved the fried potatoes for a crunchy texture element. 

The medium-spicy garlic flavor was on-point, aromatic with a good mala numbing spice. The large pot can feed 3-4 people but we couldn't stop digging in for more because of that addictive spice.

Food service took a long time because a group of 20 rolled in before us which delayed the kitchen by 45 minutes. The staff was super apologetic and gave us several updates on when our order was coming. 

They do have a note outside to let customers know orders may take longer than expected because they're in soft opening mode. Not going to dock them for service since they're managing customer expectations which I appreciate. 

It's a small space so it's best for groups of 2-4 people.

Parking, well it's SF but it's not as tough in this area since there's not that many commercial businesses on the block. 

There's nothing like Sizzling Pot King in the area so I think they're going to do really well in the hood. I can't wait to return!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Ok I tried beef and lamb with spam instant  noodles and extra spicy. This was GOOD. Actually spicy, very flavorful and a substantial amount of food. Much better than the last one I tried (chicken wings and duck--soggy wings and boney duck)

Service could be improved (more waiters?) but they are nice.
author: Lydia Z.

description:
The food is great, there aren't many places with drypot in the area. 

However the 1 star is for the terrible service and policy of not seating lesser parties when half of the restaurant is empty. 

2 of us came at 530pm when half of the restaurant is basically empty, the host looked at us and didn't even bother to come and greet us, but just motioned for us to put our names down on an iPad behind us. I looked at the half empty place and went up to the counter, host again rudely said you are not party of 4 so you have to wait.

So we started to wait, in the 20m we stood waiting, no party of 4 came, but 2 more parties of 2 came and they were also told to wait. Finally we got seated and by that point they had 2 more parties of 2 waiting and yet still half of the restaurant is empty.

I understand if you need to make room for the larger parties, but you should seat your party of 2s after a certain amount of time, otherwise people will leave, get pissed or both.

I won't be returning anytime soon even though I love drypot... Penny wise, pound foolish policy.
author: Wei Z.

description:
Date & Time:  Wednesday February 7, 2018 @ 6pm
Stars:  4.5 Stars
Dinner Date:  The Husband
Scene:  Darling Shanghai Couples & Groups of Parachute Kids in Yeezy Sweatshirts, Minis, Yeezy Kicks & MCM Bags.  
Music:  Imagine Dragons, Beyonce, Portugal The Man
Decor:  Bright & Cheery; Faux Animal Heads
Service:  Attractive, Friendly, Efficient
Devour:  Pot Stickers, Dry Spicy Pot(we opted for lunch meat, really, who doesn't love Spam:/ & sausage), Pumpkin Bread
Total:  $39.95 After QR Code on FB
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
Came when there was still the opening discount. It was a mess especially compared to my experience at the Sunnyvale location. Hopefully it was just related to the opening and not a long term thing.

Most of the other dishes that weren't a pot were already out.

They didn't know how to deal with a vegetarian friend who still wanted to order a pot. Different staff gave different choices on what she could order. Eventually they figured it out. 

They forgot an order of dumplings. We were waiting a long time for it when we realized they never listed it on the receipt of food you ordered.

I'd had the medium spicy before which entailed eating a lot of rice and drinking tons of water. So we decided to go with the mild spicy. It was a disappointment that our catfish pot wasn't spicy at all. It still was a decent dish.
author: Sophia L.

description: Met my daughter K for a late brunch on Sunday. She picked Sizzling Pot King in Soma. Apparently they have multiple locations and serve Gan Guo which is a one dry pot dish. When we arrived there was parking on the side street right next to the restaurant. As far as the decor is minimal, white washed walls and basic table and chairs. The menu is colorful and the prices are very reasonable. The one thing about Gan Guo's is that no matter how many items you add to the pot towards everything is stir fried in one sauce and one pot. Therefore we tried to order some side dishes to change up the flavors. Out of the 7 side dishes we wanted they only had one, the gizzards which was awful. We had leftover gizzards and we did not want to take it home. The pot itself was pretty good. The main items we chose were the baby cuttlefish, tripe, lobster balls and the beef tongue. The beef tongue was especially good, well cooked and tender. We were the second to last customers for lunch that day and the staff wanted everyone to finish up and get out even though they were polite about it. The Sizzling Gan Guo's is ok once a year for me. Minus stars for not having almost all of side dishes on the menu.
author: George F.

description:
I love the regular hot pots but wanted to try the dry hot pot for the first time. Checked in for lunch with my coworker who's an expert on Asian cuisine. 

Firstly, they are not serving the small pot option which is on the menu. We ordered a medium chicken pot with extra rice. It looked good and appetizing . I am someone who adds an extra salt and pepper to most of my dishes and I felt the food very salty here. The veggies in the hot pot were cooked well and were yummy then the meat itself. Overall it was OK.

Good:
1. Not many places around here have a dry hot pot.
2. Lot of meat options (chicken, lamb, beef, seafood, bullfrog etc.)
3. Service is quick
4. Portion size is decent
5. Has the hot pot cool factor 

Bad:
1. Too salty 
2. Not everything on the menu is available 

I feel that a rating of 3.5/5.0 is apt here but Yelp wouldn't allow me to do that.
author: Keerthi C.

description:
Yum! Finally dry hot pot in the Bay area. Really enjoyed the pot. Also pretty accommodating for vegetarians. I asked for a veggie pot and was allowed to order off menu and select any 6 (med bow) or 10 (large bowl) veggies I wanted.

Really really hits the spot during San Francisco "summers"

Only wish it was in a less sketchy spot.
author: Anna C.

description: This place has become my new favorite restaurant in San Francisco. As someone from Chengdu, I really loved the lamb short rib pot - since my bf couldn't eat spicy food, we always ordered seafood flavor non spicy but it's so delicious!!!! Love the portion and price. Will keep going back every week. Bull frog was a little disappointing compared to what we can get in China. Haven't tried other things yet.
author: Alice Z.

description: This restaurant is really tasty for spicy food. Especially the spicy pot. I will recommend this restaurant.
author: Nicole L.

description:
Little gem in SOMA. 

Usually very good. Recommend the steak, chinese sausage and fish (watch out, there are bones), but not the duck (very little meat and skin is not crispy). 

Takeout: Takeout orders come out a little soggy. They are quite fast though and even on a Friday or Saturday night, the orders are ready within 15 - 25 minutes.
author: Michelle B.

description:
This place always has a long line and since it's always packed on my walk home, I had to check it out.

I realized that the clientele is mostly Chinese speaking and there are multiple locations. They must be popular across all locations to have a line on the sidewalk like this.

My roommates and I, the three of us ordered a large pot with beef and pork ribs. We added some additional veggies like bok choy and shiitake mushrooms. Sadly, the meat was poor quality and super chewy. Very few shiitake mushrooms were added even though we paid extra!

Also, we ordered pot stickers that never showed up at our table. Like many typical Chinese restaurants, service is quite poor. You'll have to wave aggressively to get any attention. With few wait staff, the wait is long even after we were seated.

The only highlight was the fried bread with condensed milk, but that's not enough to get me to come back.
author: Nitar L.

description:
Most of the hot pot places I know in SF aren't dry hot pot places so I'm really glad we finally have a place nearby for this. Sizzling Pot King is chain, and I believe the closest one to here is in Sunnyvale.

You basically build your own stir fry by picking the spice level, the protein, and add-ons. I added a lot of add-ons like fish/shrimp/lobster ball, pig blood, enoki mushroom, vermicelli, tofu, etc.

The spicy pot is served over a live fire so the food is consistently kept hot. Each pot comes with a 'vegetable base' like bean sprouts, cauliflower, broccoli, potato, and celery.

I think overall the flavor is pretty singular. It's the standard sichuan ma la flavor but I prefer it to be more numbing and spicy. Even the spiciest spice level is not very spicy which I guess is a good thing if you don't typically eat spice.

The quality of the meat is not very good. I'm so glad I picked pork belly (五花肉) because it was the only one I really enjoyed out of the lamb/beef choices. Also most of the meats come with bone which is not fun for lazy people like me.

There are so many different options for meats though which is a plus. Options include but not limited to: catfish, frog, beef tongue, lamb.
author: Alicia L.

description:
This place is almost perfect.   They make it spicy enough, but not as much as I would hope for.  The veggies, noodles, and spam are great.  The tofu is really a standout.  It absorbs a lot of flavor but still maintains a nice texture.

I have to take away a star though because the beef was gross.  Too thick, weirdly shaped, tough, and veiny.
author: Jason F.

description:
First time getting dry pot! Wasn't sure what to expect but the menu is pretty straight forward. Pick your flavor, spiciness level, size, meat and sides (veggies).

There were a ton of meat choices, ranging from standard options you'd see like beef and chicken to more exotic choices like snail and bullfrog. My friend and I weren't feeling too adventurous so we picked a large pot with short ribs and chicken to share. The included sides were potatoes, celery, cauliflower and beansprouts. 

The pot came out pretty quickly and everything was tasty! Only complaint was too much celery and bean sprouts, they felt like filler.  With the large pot portions, I'd definitely recommend coming here if you're with a group and looking for something different to share.
author: Jon L.

description: Amazing texture and spicy! Super delicious hot pot! Authentic Chinese food! The location is right in the heart of South San Francisco and opens daily. A lot of varieties to choose from for meat and veggie and level of spices!
author: Will L.

description: food is fresh and tasty, hope I can come here more often. Btw, I love songs played here, all my type hhhh
author: Huo G.

description: Pretty good pot in the city. Spicy and authentic Chinese food. I went there 3-4 times and will come back whenever I wanna have heavy, delicious and meaty food
author: Jerry L.

description: Great service and amazing food! They have couple of very good vegetarian options. I would definitely go there again.
author: Sonali C.

description:
If the lord came down and said, "Bringeth onto me the sustenance that you lust for, a food that has married fire to flavour"... I'll take Him to this place.

Seriously good Chinese food, no frills. Love the one in SF, and now it's here on my doorstep.

Fat shall I become.
author: Yohan S.

description:
Looks like I'm the first reviewer here. This business is essentially the one for Chinese. I tried its Cupertino shop earlier and it was pretty nice. Although I'm not a big fan of this kind of spicy pot food despite it's extremely famous in Chinese college student community, their hot pot taste pretty nice with fresh veggies and meat. 
Though the restaurant locates in SOMA, it keeps it's looking like a restaurant in China's college town. I don't like it that much personally, but it's gonna be good for nostalgia because of its authentic flavor and plain decoration.
author: Jason C.

description:
I used to eat dry pot all the time as a quick lunch or dinner when I was working in China, and was sad that no such specialty place existed here. As the only dry pot restaurant I've ever found in the US, it definitely satisfied my craving! 

You start with a protein base that also includes a few vegetables already (potatoes, bean sprouts, cauliflower). You can pick the flavor, level of spiciness, and size. For dinner there are only two sizes, medium and large. We tried both, and realized that the large doesn't have that much more food, so instead of getting a large combo, we thought it was a better deal to pay $10 more and get two medium pots instead.

Next you can do some add ons, which includes a pretty wide selection of protein, vegetables, and noodles. We added a couple of veggies to every pot and everyone loved the extra flavor. It didn't take too long for the food to come out. Since we had a big group, we got to try a few different things. The beef was a little dry, but generally all the other meats were good. 

All together we tried 4 pots and the fish for 4 people. The fish was so so, definitely not the giant portion you get in China and less flavorful, but we liked all the pots. Total came out to ~$25 per person and we were absolutely stuffed. I think between 2 people one medium pot with lots of add ones would be perfect.
author: Julie Z.

description: The food is really good!!! Beef Tongue is the best, we added tofu and lots of veggies, all of them are super good. It's really good.
author: Yilu H.

description:
I came here twice in one week! I noticed this spot (more like a hole in the wall) on my commute home from work. Usually the door is usually open and you can see there's a wait inside for dinnertime. Plus all the patrons are Chinese-speaking so it seemed like an authentic spot to me.

It's sizzling hot pot (but dry, so with a sauce instead of soup broth) so the food comes in a pot with a flame that they light underneath. You pick the meat options and it comes with potato and celery by default as sides; you can also order more sides for small fees. I got the medium size both times and it's enough to feed two with leftovers, or three just fine. At around $20, that's a pretty good deal in SF! The food is pretty tasty.

I like spicy food and tried the spiciest level the first time, and it was a little bit painful, so opted for medium spicy the next time. There's the fancy options here like beef tongue, snails, pig intestine, etc. which is up my alley. Came here with a non-adventurous person the first time so had to get regular beef. The second time I got snail, which felt a little underwhelming since they're little pieces and lacked much flavor. But you never know until you try...

I want to come back and try the different meat options! Next time I'd probably try the beef tongue and squid or cuttlefish. If you come right at 5 or 6 on a weekday there shouldn't be much of a wait. I went back on a holiday (July 4th) around 7pm and we had to wait about half an hour. Also, you supposedly get 10% off if you pay all in cash.

It's crowded, probably not the best service and not the classiest ambience, but the food is what I'm about and Sizzling Pot King gets a good rating in my book.
author: Electra C.

description: Food and service are good. Prices are inexpensive - two people with left overs: $25.00. Noise is loud. I will return.
author: Tom L.

description: Hand out with boyfriend this Friday night. Now this spot is in San Francisco，still taste good. ：）
author: Chloe Y.

description:
The waiter said " we close soon, but take your time and enjoy your food "

After that, one skinny girl came and said " we close, go home '

omg.... what a rude......

We had Griddle Cooked Beef pot and Cooked Duck Gizzard.
We got food poisoning... even thought all food were cooked....

never come back.....
author: Iguanatte S.

description: Very tasty dry pot and they let you choose the flavors. Be really careful about the Numbing & Spicy flavor because it's too much numbing! I couldn't feel my lips & tongue!!!
author: Edwin Z.

description: We ordered a pot with beef tongue n the other one with frog.  Both mild spicy.   Both taste very delicious so nothing left over.   Recommend to all but be aware of your spicy tolerance.  Service is great too.  Don't forget to check in for their promotion deal.
author: Emiliy L.

description: Great place to have dinner. Food is good. I choose beef tounge and chicken. The spicy is good.
author: He X.

description:
I've already been here twice in the last few weeks. We always get the garlic sauce, which is delicious. 

After you choose a base (we like chicken), you can add as many toppings as your want. We always select fried tofu and instant noodles, which really soak up the sauce. I might even get double orders of the fried tofu next time, because it is so tasty!

NOTE that the size of the pot only affects how much of the base you get. The amount of topping appears to be to same. So if you get a lot of toppings like we usually do, you will not see a noticeable difference between the medium and large sizes. 

Other dishes there that we love: fried potstickers, pumpkin cake, and the steamed and fried chinese bread with condensed milk. 

Expect a wait on Friday and Saturday nights, unless you get there at opening or after the first round of diners leave around 8-8:30. The restaurant seems to be packed with customers from mainland China, which is a testament to the quality of the food.  

No complaints about the service. They have plenty of servers, who are always busy, but will come over pretty quickly if you waive them down.
author: Harris L.

description:
I ordered off Uber Eats and chose spicy. Now, I can handle my spice level. This came SO spicy that it was inedible. I have $70 worth of food that I can't eat.

I called the restaurant to see what they could do - they kept accusing me of choosing very very spicy (which they I didn't).  I asked if they could at least remake one of the dishes and I could pick it up, but they told me it was Uber's problem. 

READ the receipt. This level of spiciness is inedible. I will never order from this restaurant again.
author: Eugene C.

description: Friendly staff and great spicy pot with huge portion,  definitely enough for 2-3 people if you order the medium size pot. I enjoyed the over-the-top spicy frog pot with wide vermicelli, Chef is from Hunan province in China where is famous for spicy cuisine. Definitely will come back.
author: Aloha M.

description:
Went there on a Wednesday night around 8 with my husband, no line in front of us, but still kinda busy.  We had the medium frog pot + pork belly + lobster ball, there were a lot of veggies come with the pot(potato, califlower, bean sprouts, celery) absolutely enough for two people. 
Staffs are friendly, dishes taste good(authentic) but the frogs are all parts, none of them is a whole frog, it looks like they were leftovers from that day, and the pork belly is literally just fats. Anyways, I'll give it another try.
author: Xinya Z.

description: Excellent restaurant that serves Chinese hot pot. I ate duck gizzard with mala sauce and it's nice though my mouth and tongue became tingling as it's spicy.
author: Keisuke W.

description: Ordered the beef tongue. It was very delicious and decently priced. The stuff is friendly ad well.
author: Zhuang X.

description: Neighborhoods Les desirable, the food was tasty,  just wasn't expecting to devein my own shrimp I guess that's a cultural thing.
author: Workout N.

description: This is a hole in the wall restaurant that's not really a hole in the wall. The outside is kind of sketchy, and we almost missed the place, but the inside is gorgeous and very tastefully decorated. It was my first time trying this kind of dish, and they did not disappoint. The flavors were aromatic and the portion sizes are huge! I would have given this place 5 stars but the staff was a little off putting. They seemed a little weirded out by me and my boyfriend- again it was our first time so we didn't really know how to order and needed help. Our server seemed a little annoyed. I also noticed he was super friendly to the customers that spoke to him in Chinese, which made me feel out of place
author: Vina V.

description:
Food was pretty good! Great amount and they are pretty delicious and fresh. Went there with a friend and I am pretty happy about the food cuz I was craving for dry hot pot for sooooooo long. Price is fair, customer service is ok.
but I don't know why they don't serve the small pot even though it's the time (Mon-Fri) I went there on a weekday noon.
CAN SOMEONE GIVE ME AN ANSWER PLS?
Medium pot is way too big for me and if u guys really don't wanna offer the small pot just cancel the option pls...
author: Emily H.

description:
Food: Excellent. Spicy is pretty darn spicy (after you make it through the top layer) and the veggies make the dish very healthy. I've never had "dry" hot pot before - only the oily Sichuan stuff, which I love.

Ambiance: Weird. I have no idea where the clientele come from, but no one there was what I would recognize as your typical SF fare. No one spoke English - and between the dyed hair, pastel oversized coats, and Harry Potter style glasses, it seemed like some mysterious wormhole from Beijing opened up and plopped people into the restaurant.
author: Sylvia L.

description: Waiting for long time with nobody call my name until I ask waiter for how long to wait, then they give me a table. Some appetizers are frozen, not even fresh. It's extremely hard to find parking place.
author: Ying B.

description: The taste is very good, the service is also very good, the weight is very large, I love it and I will go to there again.
author: ZeLin F.

description: I came here for lunch today and shared a frog mixed pot with my girlfriend. Really tasty! Just a heads up, if you order frog, be prepared to deal with a lot of small bones. We had ordered mild spice, but got medium spice by mistake, and it was a little overwhelming. Glad we had a carafe of water sitting on the table! Definitely order some rice as well, as it goes really well with the hotpot. If you're still hungry, I highly recommend getting the fried doughnut dessert. Six pieces of delicious fried goodness with a plate of condensed milk is a nice way to round out the meal. Definitely coming back!
author: Austin W.

description:
This place opened up recently near my house and I've been wanting to try it for a long time. When it first opened the lines were crazy long and out the door but not anymore. 

Me and my friend shared a medium spicy sparerib bowl with ramen noodle (a must), cabbage, and lotus root. It was large enough that we had leftover. It could probably be shared between 3 people perfectly. Everything was super flavorful and definitely SPICY. Can imagine myself being a regular here.

Wasn't the biggest fan of the sparerib as a protein will try another meat next time.
author: Anna H.

description: I went there with my friends and ordered the spicy pot with meat and mixed vegetables. It's very authentic and veeeery spicy - be mindful of the spicy level you ask for! The funny thing is that we read a yelp review that it was not very spicy and almost ordered the super spicy level. We ended up ordering medium spicy but it still turned out to be super hot - still worth it though! :)
author: Qingyu L.

description: It would have been higher if they weren't too lazy to prepare the food on the menu.  I mean out of the ten dishes that they had, more than half were not available.  the service was pretty bad.  No one cared to see if we needed anything.  Also, for some reasons, this place is infested with flies.  Like literally, infested.  There were at 10 flies just around my table.  I also see other people try to sway their flies away.  I probably wouldn't go nack again.  The food itself was pretty good. But that's it.
author: Tom C.

description: We came here multiple times already and enjoyed a lot. It's our spicy comfort food and totally customizable. Even the non-spicy version tastes good. You would definitely need a lot of rice to go with!
author: Venice M.

description: Great authentic dry hot pot restaurant.  Can customize pots.  Flavorful and adventurous menu.
author: Karen Y.

description: Definitely approved it is a really authentic spicy dry pot! Me and my friend love the food here!!! Duck neck is the most favorable, it is spicy enough for me! I should to go some next time! We ordered the combo dry pot with beef tongue and bullfrog. The bullfrog is fresh, and I love it! I think only the pork ear I feel a little bit weird of the taste. Last but not least, I love the fried bread. It is a must try one, not so many Chinese restaurants have it and make it so crispy. Of coz there is always a line, but we only wait for like 20 mins. Will come back soon.
author: Rainy G.

description: I had hot pot here at least twice a week. My favorite combination is beef tongue + catfish
author: Xiaochen Z.

description: Really great food. Medium is more than enough for 2 people, and everything tasted delicious - - total was $28 plus tip. Service was attentive, happy to see a good restaurant go in this area.
author: Max N.

description: This is my favorite dry pot place! Servings for takeout are always huge, and foods are really nice as well.
author: Tracy C.

description: Yummy! One of my best place!! The food is authentic with great quality. The service is also good!
author: Julia C.

description: I must say, this is favorite restaurant in SF. The pot was so delicious, I just randomly picked a main dishes which is beef tendon. I recommend hot and spicy and medium spicy!
author: Charlene Z.

description: This spicy pot restaurant is located near the civic center BART station. It provides authentic spicy pots dishes, and is very popular in the city.
author: Kkkl Z.

description: The food was delicious! Well worth the wait! You'll notice a lot of take-out! Come hungry too! Because it's a lot of food and if you think you can handle heat and spice, don't underestimate! Good job guys! Improve on the take-out process!
author: PJ V.

description: I do not want to comment for the food today. It is for sure not able to compare with the ones in China. The service here is terrible. The place is very small and noisy. Waiter asked me to switch table but would not clean up the one that is available claiming that they are busy. When I order for the food, the female waiter is also very impatient. We all know that service matter for a restaurant and this why they it's not the best place.
author: Yilin X.

description: The spicy frog was so good. I miss this kind of food and it isn't easy finding flavor like this in the U.S. looking forward to coming back here again in the future!
author: Gake G.

description: The food here is delicious at a reasonable price, recommended for dinner. Very convenient location and opens late everyday
author: Ran M.

description: We ordered fish pot and frog (have you ever tried that XD), very delicious and authentic. Will definitely come again！
author: Joy T.

description: It wasn't a very good experience. The waiters didn't allow us to sit in the 6-people table, although we have five people. My parents were above seventy years old and we had a child with us. The restaurants was empty, we didn't understand why do we have to sit in the corner.it is so bad service
author: Bin S.

description: Love it. Catfish is my favorite. The Sunnyvale location is better than the one in SF though
author: Elain H.

description: Horrible experience, the waiter dude with long hair servers with a shitty face and super impatient altitude. I have never seen someone awful like him.
author: How H.

description: Great, authentic Chinese food. Lively atmosphere and super nice servers who checked to see how the flavor and spice level was. I hope this place does well! It's one of the few real Chinese spots outside of the Richmond or Sunset neighborhoods.
author: Jackie L.

description: Great food! Very authentic! We came here after a long day of shopping and it was perfect for the cold SF weather. We ordered frog and lots of veggies. Veggies were super tasty.  Will come again!
author: Sunny Z.

description: Very delicious. My friend and I ordered catfish and frog mixed pot. Everything in the pot is just on point! The service is also good. Will be back!
author: Wen P.

description: I celebrate Mother's Day with family in sizzling pot king, it is very disappointed! The frog is not fresh, it is frozen! The fish is tasteless! The girl sit next table complained to the waitress that the pork ear was not fresh, smell stink. My mom was upset, this place ruined my Mother's Day! The only good thing is if pay cash get 10% off.
author: Alice D.

description:
Friday night: 17:30 to 19:00

Waiters there took extremely incredible LONG time to serve. We waited there for an hour, because they gave our 3 people table to a 7 people group. The big group says they can squeeze in a small table, but they took our table as well. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone.
author: Jiaxin X.

description: Longggggg asssss line. Was told half hour, and actually waited an hour and half. The food is not that good at all, and they make you choose pre made manuel instead make your own. Food portion is much at all, small amount and waste of Money.
author: Shuai Z.

description: So glad that this place is now in SF!!!! I loved it in San Diego and it is just as good!!! Highly recommend the lamb! The medium is more than enough for two people and their service is incredible. We handed them an empty rice container because we wanted it off the table but they ended up giving us seconds muahaha. Will definitely be back as I wish to try more of their proteins and flavors!!!
author: Axl B.

description:
Do not eat here !!!
There meat is bad, I order chicken today , it stink and sour !! How could chicken gone that bad? Because they use very heavy seasoning and spices on food to hide the bad meat! It is so disgusting. 

The service is bad too , not organized , and pushing so much for order when we are not ready !

They post a lot of ads on everywhere , but using rotten meat , is not taking your business to anywhere 

Will not eat again !
author: Zichen M.

description: Nice service, the food is good; however might be hard to find parking around the area. No line during weekday lunch time.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Got the hunan duck pot, spice hot flavor med spicy, with quail egg, noodles, chinese sausage and a few other additions. Came out to $37 pre tip (which factors in a random $6 discount). Overall tasty food  though the med spicy came out to be more numbing than hot-spicy. Wait on a Friday night was about 30-40 mins (came at 7:50) for 2 people.
author: Lol C.

description: This is as authentic as it gets for dry hot pot close to downtown.  The food is mostly ready to go so there's not much time before they bring the hotpot almost ready to eat.  I forgot my credit card and they were kind enough to hold it over a very long holiday weekend.
author: Paul C.

description: This meal was SO GOOD! Everything was delicious and the service was on point. Loved every second of this meal. I will definitely be coming back. +Pork Belly and get double instant noodles.
author: Mari C.

description: Delicious spicy food! Generous portions with lots of meat options that you should find at a Chinese restaurant.
author: Kat L.

description: Very nice place! They cooked the way really like what I had in China before, which is hard to find in the state here!
author: Shelly K.

description: Food and service are great. No wait time when you eat here during lunch. Would definitely come back to try other food. FYI, they don't have small pot anymore. Only medium and big.
author: K. O.

description: We had a medium pot with bull frogs, pretty good. Because they are a new place, they are particularly nice. They gave us a 30% discount after we shared this place on social network. The waiters kept asking customers if there was anything to improve upon.
author: Haoru H.

description: This is a great taste Chinese restaurant. My friends and I were having dinner together. We had a great time. We ordered shrimp, fish, chicken wings, and it's all good.
author: Xun S.

description: This one is the first dried hot pot in SF. And we have tried four flavors. All the food is good!
author: Vini Z.

description: The food here is delicious! The bullfrogs taste so good! And side dishes are great! I would highly recommend my friends to come here!
author: 园林

description: Reasonable price, expected flavor, but, it was soooooo slow! It was around 830pm, my friend and I were waiting for seating, also, there was one table waiting for the order, one table needs to clean. We almost waiting for 10 mins, during that period, the waiter's work process was: clean table- take the order- seat us. There were at least five tables cleaned and already, he should seat new customer and gave us menu, and then take the order, finally cleaned the table, after that, we also already for order. It should be the most reasonable and efficient process.
author: Lu G.

description: Good food, really authentic!   Reasonable prices with great flavor.   Check out this new place in soma.
author: George G.

description: Came here on Sat at 10:40. Staff said the place was actually open at 11. But by 11, they said the kitchen wasn't ready. So decided to leave. Hope to try the food in the future. But based on how ready they were for service have to give it bad review.
author: Anthony W.

description: Skip this restaurant at all cost. They make you share table just to make more profit, and let other cut in front of you to make you wait more. Food taste bad and uncook meat.
author: Eki L.

description: As traditional pot, it is acceptable. Oily , spicy and salty. It could be described as traditional Chinese food, but the price is a little high.
author: Simin G.

description: They claim to be open till 10pm, but when I arrived at 9:20 they declared otherwise.
author: dark l.
